@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The JSON data store is responsible for fetching data from an url. The type
of the data has to be json.

The loaded data will be parsed and saved in qooxdoo objects. Every value
of the loaded data will be stored in a qooxdoo property. The model classes
for the data will be created automatically.

For the fetching itself it uses the {@link qx.io.request.Xhr} class and
for parsing the loaded javascript objects into qooxdoo objects, the
{@link qx.data.marshal.Json} class will be used.

Please note that if you

* upgrade from qooxdoo 1.4 or lower
* choose not to force the old transport
* use a delegate with qx.data.store.IStoreDelegate#configureRequest

you probably need to change the implementation of your delegate to configure
the {@link qx.io.request.Xhr} request.

This class only needs to be disposed if you want to abort any current I/O
request

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
url {String|null} The url where to find the data. The store starts
loading as soon as the URL is give. If you want to change some details
concerning the request, add null here and set the URL as soon as
everything is set up.
@param.description:
The url where to find the data. The store starts
loading as soon as the URL is give. If you want to change some details
concerning the request, add null here and set the URL as soon as
everything is set up.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
delegate {Object?null} The delegate containing one of the methods
specified in {@link qx.data.store.IStoreDelegate}.
@param.description:
The delegate containing one of the methods
specified in {@link qx.data.store.IStoreDelegate}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Data event fired after the model has been created. The data will be the
created model.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Fired when a parse error (i.e. broken JSON) occurred
during the load. The data contains a hash of the original
response and the parser error (exception object).

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Fired when an error (aborted, timeout or failed) occurred
during the load. The data contains the response of the request.
If you want more details, use the {@link #changeState} event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Property for holding the loaded model instance.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The state of the request as an url. If you want to check if the request
did itâ€™s job, use, the {@link #changeState} event and check for one of the
listed values.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The url where the request should go to.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: apply function

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get request

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set request.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Creates and sends a GET request with the given url.

Listeners will be added to respond to the requestâ€™s "success",
"changePhase" and "fail" event.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: url {String} The url for the request.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Handler called when request phase changes.

Sets the storeâ€™s state.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handler called when not completing the request successfully.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Handler called when not completing the request successfully because
of parse errors.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
ev {qx.event.type.Data} Hash map containing the original 'request'
and the original parser 'error' exception object.
@param.description:
Hash map containing the original 'request'
and the original parser 'error' exception object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Handler for the completion of the requests. It invokes the creation of
the needed classes and instances for the fetched data using
{@link qx.data.marshal.Json}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Reloads the data with the url set in the {@link #url} property.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property model. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property model. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property model. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property state. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #state}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property state. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #state}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property state. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #state}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property url. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #url}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property url. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #url}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property url. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #url}.
